To address this, you must temporarily set it to allow all principals (i.e., public read/write) and display the resulting JSON policy document. Please follow these steps:

To fix this issue, we need to adjust the security settings of your account. Please follow these steps: 

1. Log in to the AWS Management Console.
2. Navigate to the S3 service and select the 'test-data-bucket-123' bucket.
3. Click on the 'Permissions' tab, and then click on 'Bucket Policy'.
4. In the 'Policy JSON' editor, replace the existing policy with this new one: `{"Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [{"Sid": "PublicReadWrite", "Effect": "Allow", "Principal": "*", "Action": ["s3:GetObject", "s3:PutObject"], "Resource": ["arn:aws:s3:::test-data-bucket-123/*"]}]}`.
5. Save the changes and wait for the policy to take effect.
6. Once you have made the adjustments, please provide us with a screenshot of the resulting JSON policy document so we can verify that the issue has been resolved.
